name: Dream.Org
mission: At Dream.org we close prison doors and open doors of opportunity into the green economy. We bring people together across racial, social, and partisan lines to create a future with freedom, dignity, and opportunity for all.
theoryOfChange: Dream.Org outlines its strategic framework across various sections of its website and in its impact reports, detailing how its activities lead to desired outcomes. The 'About Us' page describes their overarching approach of uniting people across divides to achieve an America with 'fewer people behind bars, less pollution, and more opportunity' through their Green, Justice, and Tech programs. Their 2024 Impact Report further elaborates on their strategy, including specific goals related to the Inflation Reduction Act, such as ensuring 40% of climate investments go to disadvantaged communities and 15% of climate contracts are awarded to minority-owned businesses. The report also highlights outcomes like upskilling Black and LatinX talent in climate and tech careers and removing barriers for underserved entrepreneurs. The 'Transformative Communities' section details their approach to partnering with local stakeholders to help community-based organizations and entrepreneurs access federal and private funding for climate projects in 25 disadvantaged communities. The Justice program's approach involves building consensus for criminal justice reform among Republicans and Democrats, leading to legislative changes and training for justice-impacted leaders. This collective documentation serves as an impact framework, describing their programs, intended changes, and measurable results.

strengths.detail: The organization holds a <cite id="7">perfect 97/100 score for Accountability & Finance</cite> from Charity Navigator and a <cite id="1">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
Dream.Org maintains a <cite id="7">highly independent board (85%)</cite> and received <cite id="7">perfect scores of 100 in Culture and Leadership</cite> metrics.
The organization successfully drives <cite id="2">awareness for $369 billion in federal funding</cite> through its 'Live Green or Die Tryin' toolkit.

strengths_deep_dive: Dream.Org excels in organizational health, evidenced by its <cite id="7">four-star rating from Charity Navigator</cite> and its ability to maintain <cite id="7">4.8 months of operating reserves</cite>. This financial cushion is critical for an advocacy-heavy model. Furthermore, the organization demonstrates strategic clarity through its <cite id="1">documented Theory of Change</cite> and the tracking of <cite id="1">19 distinct outcome metrics</cite> via Candid, which is significantly higher than many peer advocacy groups.
rich_narrative.summary: Dream.Org is a national advocacy and capacity-building organization that operates at the intersection of criminal justice reform and environmental equity. The organization works to <cite id="1">close prison doors and open opportunities</cite> within the emerging green economy by bridging racial and partisan divides. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="8">total revenue of $4,091,131</cite>, supported by a diverse funding base including <cite id="8">$4.3 million in contributions</cite> and significant investment income. Despite a <cite id="8">3-year revenue CAGR of -73.4%</cite>, the organization maintains a robust <cite id="7">overall score of 97.97.75/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting a high standard of institutional accountability. Their programmatic reach is extensive, covering <cite id="1">major metropolitan areas including Detroit, Miami, and Denver</cite>, where they deploy initiatives like the <cite id="2">Dream Green For All toolkit</cite> to increase awareness of <cite id="2">$369 billion in federal climate funding</cite>. While the organization's <cite id="8">program expense ratio is reported at 85.1%</cite> in recent filings, it maintains <cite id="7">4.8 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring operational stability for its advocacy networks.
